gw.testharness.clustering

Class ClusterMember

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.testharness.clustering.ClusterMember

  • public class ClusterMember
extends java.lang.Object
    Handle to the remote server. Can be used to ask the server to call methods and run tests. Provides several cluster-related convinient methods OOTB.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClusterMember(java.lang.String baseUrl, java.lang.String serverId, boolean batch, gw.testharness.clustering.ServerInstance serverInstance, ClusterTest test)
      Creates a handle to remote server

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object callTestMethod(java.lang.String method, java.io.Serializable... args)
      Call specified method on the server.
      java.lang.String getLogicalName()
      Returns server logical name in the cluster
      int getMembersCount()
      Returns number of cluster members (from this server's point of view)
      java.lang.String getUUID()
      Returns server UUID in the cluster
      boolean isBatchServer()
      Returns true if this server is a batch server.
      boolean isCoordinator()
      Returns true if this server is a coordinator in the cluster.
      void killServer()
      Stop server WITHOUT notifying other nodes in the cluster, i.e. from the cluster point of view this method simulates incorrect shutdown of the server.
      void networkDown()
      Simulates failure of network link.
      void networkUp()
      Simulates restoration of network link.
      void reconnectToCluster()
      Disconnects and reconnects server to the cluster,
      void runGosuTestMethod(java.lang.String testClass, java.lang.String testMethod, java.io.Serializable... args)
      Run Gosu test on the server
      void setLoggingLevel(org.apache.log4j.Level level)
      Sets JGroups logging level.
      void startServer()
      Starts the server with clustering enabled.
      void startServer(IClusterConfigurator clusterConfigurator, org.apache.log4j.Level clusterLogLevel) 
      void stopServer()
      Gracefully stops the sever.
      void tryStartServer()
      Use this when error is expected during startup and the server should not be discarded.

             boolean batch,

             ClusterTest test)
        Creates a handle to remote server
        Parameters:
        baseUrl - URL of the NodeControllerServlet
        serverId - Server ID for the remote server
        batch - true if remote server must be a batch one
        serverInstance -
        test - running test.

    • Method Detail

      • startServer

        public void startServer()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Starts the server with clustering enabled. Server will start with the specified _serverId and will be a batch server if _isBatch is set to true
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • startServer

        public void startServer(IClusterConfigurator clusterConfigurator,
               org.apache.log4j.Level clusterLogLevel)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • tryStartServer

        public void tryStartServer()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Use this when error is expected during startup and the server should not be discarded.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • stopServer

        public void stopServer()
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Gracefully stops the sever. Note that while stopping the server will send LEAVE message to the cluster notifying other nodes about its stop (thus will be excluded out of the cluster immediatelly).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • killServer

        public void killServer()
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Stop server WITHOUT notifying other nodes in the cluster, i.e. from the cluster point of view this method simulates incorrect shutdown of the server.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • networkDown

        public void networkDown()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Simulates failure of network link. The node will not be able to send or receive messages from other nodes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • networkUp

        public void networkUp()
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Simulates restoration of network link.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • reconnectToCluster

        public void reconnectToCluster()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Disconnects and reconnects server to the cluster,
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • isCoordinator

        public boolean isCoordinator()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns true if this server is a coordinator in the cluster. Note that this method throws UnsupportedOperationException if non-JGroups cluster channel is used.
        Returns:
        true if this server is a coordinator
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • callTestMethod

        public java.lang.Object callTestMethod(java.lang.String method,
                              java.io.Serializable... args)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Call specified method on the server. If method throws an exception it will be serialized, transferred back to the caller, deserialized, and re-thrown from this method.
        Parameters:
        method - method name.
        args - optional array of arguments
        Returns:
        result of the method if any.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - local or remote exception (WrappedRemoteException)

      • runGosuTestMethod

                     java.lang.String testMethod,
                     java.io.Serializable... args)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Run Gosu test on the server
        Parameters:
        testClass - fully qualified name of the test class.
        testMethod - test method
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - local or remote exception (WrappedRemoteException)
